content: Dr David Bell | Introduction | Brunel University London Skip to Content Home People Dr David Bell Dr David BellReader Wilfred Brown Building 111 Email: david.bell@brunel.ac.uk Tel: +44 (0)1895 265845 Director of the STAHR Research Centre CTO of Brunel Spinout (HecoAnalytics Limited) Computer Science College of Engineering, Design and Physical Sciences Summary David is a Reader in the Department of Computer Science, at Brunel University of London.  David is a keen multi-disciplinary researcher who has applied novel digital service solutions in a range of domains (including digital health).  His research interest lies in Service Design, Emotion AI, Cyber Security, Semantic technologies – often driven by machine learning and simulation and focusing on digital health.  David has collaborated on a number of funded research grants investigating the modelling of health evidence, augmenting naturalistic cultural settings with museum objects, trading personal data and simulating COVID-19. He has also worked with a number of NHS collaborators on the design of apps that optimise or analyse patient pathways.  David has supported the NHS advising on Health Data AI and Digital Hospital working groups.  Before returning to university, David worked for several small and large software development companies and then in Investment Banking becoming technology director.  More recently, David has commercialised his previous health evidence modelling research grant into HecoAnalytics Limited (a Brunel University of London spin-out). Qualifications PhD, MBA, BSc(Hons) Responsibility Director - STAHR Research Centre
